cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting west-northwest, expected to turn west-southwest and move ashore near the southern North Carolina coast, then stall/move very slowly across eastern-central South Carolina before curving northward across the Appalachians toward the Mid-Atlantic interior early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA; Storm-Surge Watch north of Duck NC to NC/VA border and Edisto Beach SC to S. Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC; Tropical-Storm Warning north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA and south of South Santee River SC to Edisto Beach SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone southern North Carolina to northeastern South Carolina with later inland flooding spreading into the Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions likely Monday-Tuesday (25–35 mph gusts).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Delaware River or New Jersey side from Florence.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain possible late Monday into Tuesday as remnant circulation passes west of the port (generally 1–3 in., locally 4 in.).
weather_observation.other_hazards: Inland river rises on the Delaware and tidal back-up could briefly slow drainage; rough Atlantic surf and dangerous rip-currents through the weekend.
